page.title: 02TYDD ST. GILES-PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The church was built about 800 years ago.It is dedicated to St.Giles who is the patron saint of beggars and cripples.The church was built of Barnack Rag which came from the Manor of Barnack in Huntingdon.It was brought along the Shire Drain in barges,and then taken to the site of the church in carts.At first the church was built with the tower built on but for various reasons it was taken down and was erected 50ft. away.The church has Norman pillars inside.It has Saxon sundials on the south wall.The great west window (which is constantly in need of repair) was designed by Alan de Walsingham who also designed the Lantern at Ely Cathedral.During one of the gales about 200 years ago the chancel was blown down.
